title: Long live Test cricket
text:
AUSTRALIA TOUR OF INDIA 2017 Long live Test cricket Cricbuzz Staff • Last updated on Tue, 07 Mar, 2017, 03:31 PM Things got heated up in the middle when Steve Smith tried to take help from the support staff for a DRS referral. © BCCI 
In what turned out to be one of the most fascinating Tests in the recent times, India shot down Australia for 112 to seal a 75-run win. Australia dominated the first day before spirited Indian fightback helped them claw their way back in the Test. At the end of third day, Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara helped India edge ahead but it was Josh Hazlewood's six-wicket haul that gave Australia a chance to seal the series. This has not been a great Batting Test pitch but it's made for a great viewing ... #INDvAUS Much prefer this type of game ... #TestCricket — Michael Vaughan (@MichaelVaughan) March 7, 2017 Long live Test cricket! Theatre at its absolute best. More twists and turns than an eighth (1st) day Indian wicket #INDvAUS — Christy Doran (@ChristypDoran) March 7, 2017 So what everyone thought would happen happens and everyone is amazed at this happening. #INDvAUS — Greg Baum (@GregBaum) March 7, 2017 Remember that kid meme? You'd be amazed what he looks like now... #indvaus pic.twitter.com/gr4jD7LRKu
